ray.rage.rendersystem

Interface RenderQueue.Listener

  • Enclosing interface:
    RenderQueue

    public static interface RenderQueue.Listener
    A listener that allows interested clients to receive render-queue events.
    Author:
    Raymond L. Rivera
    See Also:
    SceneManager#addRenderQueueListener(Listener)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onPostRenderQueues()
      Event raised after all the render-queues have been processed.
      void onPreRenderQueues()
      Event raised before any of the render-queues are processed.
      boolean onRenderQueueEnded(RenderQueue rq)
      Event raised immediately after the specified render-queue has been processed by a render-system.

      Event raised immediately before the specified render-queue is processed by a render-system.

    • Method Detail

      • onPreRenderQueues

        void onPreRenderQueues()
        Event raised before any of the render-queues are processed.

      • onPostRenderQueues

        void onPostRenderQueues()
        Event raised after all the render-queues have been processed.

      • onRenderQueueStarted

        boolean onRenderQueueStarted(RenderQueue rq)
        Event raised immediately before the specified render-queue is processed by a render-system.

        The client can determine whether the queue processing should proceed by returning true, or cancelled by returning false. If there're multiple listeners already registered, then the last listener to be invoked gets to make the final decision. No guarantees are given regarding the order in which the invocations may take place.

        Parameters:
        rq - The render-queue about to be processed.
        Returns:
        True if the contents of this render-queue should be rendered by the render-system in this invocation. False if it should be skipped.

      • onRenderQueueEnded

        boolean onRenderQueueEnded(RenderQueue rq)
        Event raised immediately after the specified render-queue has been processed by a render-system.

        The client can determine whether the queue should be immediately processed again by returning true, or only once by returning false. If there're multiple listeners already registered, then the last listener to be invoked gets to make the final decision. If a repeated invocation is specified, then the onRenderQueueStarted(RenderQueue) event will be re-emitted prior to processing, followed again by this event.

        The client is responsible for avoiding an infinite event processing loop

        Parameters:
        rq - The render-queue that just got processed.
        Returns:
        True if the contents of this render-queue should be rendered again by the render-system in this invocation. False otherwise.
